title: Do you think that we have fallen as a society where we have gone from Whitney H's 'I want to dance with somebody' to Cardi B's 'WAP'? - Quora

response.answer_text: One year before “Whitney Houston - I Wanna Dance with Somebody (Who Loves Me)” was released, there was “Chris de Burgh - Lady in Red”  I think this is a boring song, and I’m glad I wasn’t born when this was a worldwide hit.  On the other hand, Bad Religion really hit their stride in the late 80s. One year after “Whitney Houston - I Wanna Dance with Somebody (Who Loves Me)”, Bad Religion released Suffer, one of my favorite punk rock albums.  Late 80s music has a mix of stuff I enjoy and stuff that bores me.  Modern day music isn’t much different. Here’s a song from this year I find deeply unpleasant.   But there’s some cool stuff as well. I really like Run the Jewels in particular.   There’s good and bad music from pretty much every time period. If you must complain about society because you like late 80s music more, at least use more than two songs as a reference point.

No. I think we’ve had filthy music and popular media for centuries. You’ve read Romeo and Juliet, right? You realize all that flowery language is just a fancy way of saying “I want to fuck you”? WAP isn’t really my thing, but I don’t see how someone could really think a sexual rap song is a sign of societal decline in the middle of a pandemic. I assure you it’s nowhere on my list of concerns.

I apologize. Whitney Houston Dance with somebody before my time. I’m was born in 94. But I have to agree human sexuality is changing very fast. We are fast reaching English TV. FUI, I don’t really like Cardi B’s style either.
